summary: The Economic and Financial Committee (EFC) is a pivotal body within the European Union, primarily tasked with fostering economic cooperation and ensuring financial stability among member states. Established under the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union, the EFC provides expert analysis and recommendations on monetary economics, facilitating dialogue on fiscal policies and economic governance. It plays a crucial role in the coordination of economic policies, particularly in the context of the Economic and Monetary Union. By assessing macroeconomic developments, the EFC contributes to the formulation of strategies aimed at enhancing economic resilience and promoting sustainable growth across the EU.
